mods.abstract: Female adult, papier-mache, shoulder head on wood-chip filled cloth body, wooden arms and lower limbs, remains little hair, periwinkle blue painted eyes, closed painted mouth, lace trimmed white underwear, dark mustard color long dress trimmed with red-brown velvet tape, wide brim hat with same materials, doll's body made by hand, dress is partially made by machine. Accompanying information describes that Jane Bell (1700-1770) wooden dolls were made in England in the early seventeen hundreds. This doll was found on a street in London after a mansion had been destroyed during the Second World War.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
